name: Protea Hotel O.R. Tambo Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Protea OR Tambo for a night either side of our holiday to Mozambique. Our room was a deluxe room with which we were pleased. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom layout was very luxurious. Both nights we ate in the restaurant and had the buffet menu which was very good. This was an excellent hotel for a stopover. The shuttle service to and from the hotel was very efficient.
reviews.title: Excellent stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night as a stopover for a morning flight
reviews.title: Amazing for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Wasn't impressed with the look or feel of the place on arrival
reviews.title: Convenient and affordable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the bar was cheap and friendly, the staff very helpful and the restaurant surprisingly good and provided a decent bottle of wine as well.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was loud and chaotic, but freshly cooked to order.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel for an Overnight Layover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: The hotel is stunning, very contemporary design! Food was slightly expensive but the overall impression was good. The service from the bar men most certainly didn't meet my satisfaction. Food was amazing and the restaurant and reception staff were very friendly.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only problem was the service at the bar.
reviews.title: Good for 1 night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Close to the airport, shuttle runs frequently and is free. Rooms are nice and clean. Breakfast is good but expensive. It is a typical hotel. Nothing great to write home about. We crashed and then woke up to drive to a new location the next day. Perfect location after a long flight!
reviews.title: what a pleasant surprise - fantastic little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: We had a overnight stay before travelling onto zambia and was pleasantly surprised with this hotel.
reviews.title: No problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great room - very comfortable bed and excellent shower. Although it is next to a main road and the airport there was no issue with noise.
reviews.title: Decent airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I spent one night with my daughter in this hotel in August between our flight back from Kruger and a morning flight to Vic Falls. We found the shuttle from the airport without difficulties and finally understood why the distance estimates between airport and hotel varies from 500m to several km...
reviews.title: Great service, surprising design

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: If you are a bird, go straight from tarmac and it is 500m, if you are a human, take the shuttle and go around the whole place, it is 5-10 min drive :)
reviews.title: Clean, well located, but noisy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: People at the check-in were very nice and we quickly got our keys. The airport/warehouse design theme of the hotel was somewhat surprising and not really nice for me but not disturbing either. The absence of a wall between bathroom and sleeping area (only a curtain) came also as a surprise, but the beds were very comfortable and the room very clean.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: We had dinner at the hotel's restaurant. We took the evening buffet that was quite nice, plentiful and tasty.
reviews.title: Nice design hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: On the next morning at the time we had to take the shuttle to the airport, a group of maybe 20 people were ahead of us, monopolizing access to the next two shuttles (it runs every 15 min).
reviews.title: I will always use this Hotel for JNB stopovers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed the one night to make plane connections. The free shuttle to and from the airport is extremely helpful. Rooms are modern and comfortable and the restaurant and bar are pleasant places to spend time. Free wireless access appreciated.
reviews.title: Convenient and Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for two days/nights having had to do some business in the greater Johannesburg area. The paraphernalia and theme of the hotel is quite different, with much of the imagery resembling an airport hanger, etc. Rooms were very neat, modern and I found it comfortable with everything I needed during a very pleasant stay. The hotel is conveniently close to the OR Tambo (Johannesburg ) International Airport, and although you can hear the planes take off and land in the close proximity, the sound insulation of this hotel is very good and the planes-noise do not prevent a good nights rest. (I think it has something to do with the exterior curtain walling which has been placed strategically to deflect the sound of vehicles and planes) The restaurant and the culinary aspects of the restaurant was also good. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms also have internet WiFi which is adequate. I really cannot fault this hotel and would stay there again without thinking twice. It is a good 3.5 ... nearing a 4 star hotel.
reviews.title: A surprisingly good hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a night unexpectedly at the Protea Hotel at OR Tambo airport en route to Cape Town. We were so impressed! Our room was small but had absolutely everything you would need, it was clean, the bathroom was new and spotless and the bed was super comfortable.
reviews.title: Made an unexpected layover very enjoyable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: We ate twice in the restaurant - dinner and breakfast. We couldn't believe the quality of the food. It was so much higher than what we thought we would get and from where we are, airport hotels are not known for their cuisine! We enjoyed huge steaks cooked perfectly and then breakfast was an amazing spread of fresh fruits, cereals, every type of cooked breakfast food you could imagine. Can you tell we loved eating there?! We didn't spend any time in the bar but it was big and looked like a good place for a sit down and some sport-watching!
reviews.title: Very nice experience, something for the flying nut

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you need to spend a night out near the airport, don't go past this one. With a complimentary shuttle to the airport and WiFi it really doesn't get much better at an airport!
reviews.title: Great airport hotel

description: Protea Hotel OR Tambo Airport – Best Location, Ultimate Convenience. The pristine four-star Protea Hotel OR Tambo Airport is set in the heart of Kempton Park, minutes from OR Tambo International Airport, South Africa’s largest airport. An aviation enthusiast’s paradise, the hotel is themed around an aircraft hangar. The industrial ambiance of the hotel is felt in the polished concrete floors, steel finishes, chrome lighting and top to bottom windows. Order a cocktail at the long, steel aircraft wing that is the bar, sink into a comfortable couch and relax as you watch the aero planes cruise to the landing strip. The lounge provides a peaceful setting with WiFi access where business travellers can conduct informal meetings. Time-conscious local and international business travellers can enjoy a convenient location 35 minutes from Sandton and Pretoria and is situated 800m from the Rhodesfield Gautrain Station. Protea Hotel OR Tambo Airport offers complimentary shuttles to and from OR Tambo International Airport between 06h15 and 22h45 daily, as well as a shuttle to and from Rhodesfield Gautrain station on request. Whether you’re stopping over or have an extended business stay ahead, Protea Hotel O.R. Tambo Airport has it all – trendy pool area, funky bar and The Warehouse restaurant.
